titlestmt.titleproper: Le-Hi-Ho (The Lehigh Valley Homophile Organization), Bethlehem, PA Records GLBTQ.2012.06

publicationstmt.publisher: GLBTQ Archives, Central Connecticut State University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-02-21T10:25-0500

did.unittitle: Le-Hi-Ho (The Lehigh Valley Homophile Organization), Bethlehem, PA Records

repository.corpname: GLBTQ Archives, Central Connecticut State University

did.abstract: Le-Hi-Ho was established in 1969 in Pennsylvania to be a safe and supportive organization for the GLBTQ community. This collection includes the group’s documents in addition to other organizations by state, articles, essays, and advertisements dating from the early 1960’s to the late 2000’s.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: LE-HI-HO was organized in 1969 in Bethlehem, Pennsylvania to give homosexuals a safe place to meet, gain information, and dispel myths about homosexuality. The group provided counsel, legal aid, outreach programs, and education (from its own extensive library) to homosexuals as well as participating in political activism and sponsering social events. All information was conveyed through meetings and a monthly newsletter. They met for 14 years at the same place, The Unitarian Church of the Lehigh Valley, a church that fully supported and promoted their cause. After the founding of a community center in 1984, the Lamba Center in Allentown, meetings were held there.

Ronald Seeds, a Connecticut gay activist, helped in the original organization of this group and served as Director for a short time. Once a part of the Mattachine Society in New York, he expressed interest in starting a homophile organization in Pennsylvania in 1969. Leaving Pennsylvania with partner Rick for Newington, Connecticut in 1990, he became actively involved in PFLAG (Parents, Families, and Friends of Lesbians and Gays) and other organizations. He also assisted in the transfer of these records to Central Connecticut State University’s GLBTQ collection, donating many of his personal items as well.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents relating to the growth of Le-Hi-Ho and its history are in this collection as well as information about other GLBTQ supportive groups in other states. Meeting agendas, minutes, correspondence, newspaper articles, event advertising, and financial paperwork from Le-Hi-Ho, and other homophile locations and institutions, are included. The collection also incorporates more broad information regarding GLBTQ topics such as aids, psychology, religion, and the arts ranging from the early 1960’s to 2002.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Cite as: Le-Hi-Ho (Lehigh Valley Homophile Organization), Bethlehem, PA (GLBTQ.2012.06). GLBTQ Archives. Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.
